name: Web Development
descrip: Something about common topics in web development courses.

topics.arg: Most web development courses include a component on HTML. A major part of HTML is its structure. It is this same structure that is leveraged by screen readers to enable blind or low-vision people to interact with the web. Thus, this is a good place to introduce the concept of accessibility.

It's important to define accessibility to your students because they may not have seen it before and knowing about it is becoming a requirement in modern web development. Etc etc (argument for topic i.e. group of LOs)

Since visualization is about sharing or communicating about data with people, it makes sense to talk about assumptions students might make about their audiences, as well as the actions that may be taken to make a visualization more accessible.
Vision’s main connection to accessibility is in its applications to accessibility problems.

One of the great things about security is the way it takes everything in the world with a grain of salt. In the case of accessibility, this could mean showing that existing accessibility tools are insecure and thinking of ways to fix them, or it could mean developing novel ways to make sure people of all abilities can have the security and privacy they require.
NLP’s main connection to accessibility is in its applications to accessibility problems.
Accessibility is a topic in its own right when it comes to human-computer interaction, but two main points of connection lie in interfaces and how people use them, and universal design methods.
There is an entire subfield of robotics devoted to accessibility, namely assistive robotics.
One thing that many students in intro programming courses don’t have yet is a clear sense of who writes programs.
This class’s lectures on historical points seem the clearest connection to accessibility.

Design of programming languages from a user perspective is an under-explored area of PL, but it’s important because:

  1. PL that are hard to learn pose barriers to engaging youth in computing
  2. PL that are error-prone cause software defects
  3. PL that are used to analyze data in science lead to errors in scientific discovery.
  4. All of the issues above can have immense economic changes, because retraining teachers and developers in the world is expensive.

Any time you talk about users, that’s a good time to consider how accessibility fits in (source of list).
The connection to accessibility here lies in two main parts: the tools which are used to interact with databases, which may be more or less accessible, and examples of applications of databases.
There are several points in a software engineering course where accessibility could be mentioned.
One of the beauties of clever algorithms is how they take advantage of characteristics of the input space in order to work. This is also possible when applied to accessibility problems.

Operating systems provide the underpinnings for all software, so it makes sense that the accessibility services they provide go a long way toward encouraging or discouraging accessibility of the applications that run on them (framework around the major factors that influence accessibility).

The main connections from AI or machine learning to accessibility lie in their applications. There is also a connection on the topic of bias, however.
